explanation: The report is correct. Right after the declaration int ret = -1; the code immediately tests if (0 >= ret). At that point ret has a known value (-1) that has not been altered, so the controlling expression is invariant (always true) for any translation unit where that #ifdef block is present. This is not one of the permitted exceptions (it is not an intentionally infinite loop nor the allowed do-while constant-false form), so it breaches MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. Note that later occurrences of the same test may become non‑invariant depending on whether ret was changed by earlier platform-specific code, but the first immediate test already constitutes a violation.
